docs.snippet: The president ignored both hard-line conservatives and populists and selected a sound nominee to be the next Fed chief.

docs.snippet: The Bernie Sanders approach to health care politics has never served the party well.

docs.snippet: Just three weeks after a national referendum showed strong support for gay marriage, Parliament voted overwhelmingly to follow the public’s lead.

headline.print_headline: Affirming Public’s Wishes, Australia Legalizes Same-Sex Marriage

docs.snippet: Party members who reject Bannonism must stand up and be counted.
The president has come to power at a time when power is passing out of the hands of governments. That’s more reassuring even than his incompetence.

docs.snippet: Facebook. Twitter DMs. Texts. So much of our communication arrives (and leaves) in little bubbles. We asked some design experts why.

headline.print_headline: Why Are All Our Words in Bubbles?
headline.main: Why Are All Our Words in Bubbles?

docs.snippet: Paolo Duterte’s daughter implied on Twitter that her father had beaten her, causing the vice mayor to strike back on Facebook.

docs.snippet: Oxford researchers join Facebook and Twitter in questioning whether Moscow used social platforms to nudge Britain out of Europe. But suspicions remain.

docs.snippet: The world’s most powerful social media company thinks it can experiment on whomever and whatever it wants.
